node.title: More American missionary hostages released in Haiti but 12 still held captive
node.alt: A man walks away from several trucks in a Haitian missionary compound
node.description: Three hostages abducted in October have been released amid an incident that has highlighted the Caribbean nation's dire kidnapping problem.
node.content:
["Three hostages kidnapped in Haiti in October have been released, US State Department spokesman Ned Price has said, adding that the United States is continuing to work to secure the release of the remaining 12 hostages.", "After visiting an orphanage back in October, 16\u00a0Americans and one Canadian, including five children, were abducted.", "The incident has highlighted Haiti's dire kidnapping problem, which has worsened in recent months amid economic troubles and political upheaval.", "A statement from Christian Aid Ministries said three\u00a0people were released on Sunday in Haiti and are \"safe and seem to be in good spirits\".", "\"We are thankful to God that three more hostages were released last night,\" said the statement from Christian Aid Ministries, a missionary organisation\u00a0based in the US state of Ohio.", "\"As with the previous release, we are not able to provide the names of the people released, the circumstances of the release, or any other details.\"", "", "
Haitian protesters carry a sign reading \"Down with\u00a0kidnappings. Free the people\".(Reuters:\u00a0Ralph Tedy Erol)
", "On November 21, the religious organisation announced that the 400 Mawozo gang had released the first two hostages of the\u00a0group of 17 kidnapped in mid-October.\u00a0", "The leader of the 400 Mawozo gang has threatened to kill the hostages unless his demands are met.", "Authorities have said the gang was seeking $US1 million per person, although it wasn't immediately clear that included the children in the group.", "Another 12 people remain captives.", "Christian Aid Ministries reiterated its request for supporters to devote Monday to Wednesday as days of prayer and fasting \"to intercede for those who are still being held as well as those who have been released\".", "The release comes amid an ongoing spike in kidnappings in the capital of Port-au-Prince and elsewhere in Haiti, which is struggling to recover from its\u00a0July 7 presidential assassination, a 7.2-magnitude earthquake that struck in mid-August and a severe fuel shortage.", "On Sunday, a gang leader known as Ti Lapli\u00a0posted a YouTube video warning people not to cross in upcoming days through the Martissant community, which has been the site of violent clashes between warring gangs.\u00a0", "\"Insecurity has increased,\" the gang leader said.", "\"I invite the people of Martissant to stock-up on food and gasoline. The next few days will be difficult \u2026 We will not remain with our arms crossed in face of those who try to destroy us.\"", "AP/Reuters"]
